ygData.subject: Re: Help running HyperNEAT experiments
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi Jason, Thanks for the manual - I finally managed to get all the experiments running. :) But now I am encountering the following problem - during the

Hi Jason,

Thanks for the manual - I finally managed to get all the experim=
ents running. :)

But now I am encountering the following problem - during =
the experiment and even after it finishes the output population file is emp=
ty (or there is no file at all).

I tired creating a empty xml and giving a=
bsolute adress for the output file, but the result is the same.

I do get w=
hat seem to be the right message at the end:

Experiment finished
Saving be=
st individuals...Done!
Deleting backup file...Done!

Any ideas what I might=
 be doing wrong (I've tried executing it almost exactly as you showed in th=
e example "./Hypercube_NEAT -I data/CheckersExperiment.dat -O Output.xml -R=
 100")?

Note: I'm not sure it if is important, but I compiled it with GUI,=
 MPI and PYTHON options off.

Thanks,
Dimitar

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com,=
 "jgmath2000" <jgmath2000@...> wrote:
>
> Hey Dimitar,
> 
> Hopefully this =
should become more clear in the HyperNEAT manual that is coming out within =
the next few days, but in the meantime:
> 
> The format for running a comma=
nd line experiment is this:
> 
> ./Hypercube_NEAT -I (input parameters file=
) -O (output population file) -R (random seed)
> 
> All of my parameter fil=
es are included in the package, so to run Checkers for example, the syntax =
is:
> 
> ./release/Hypercube_NEAT.exe -I ./data/CheckersExperiment.dat -O C=
heckersOutputPopulation.xml -R 1000
> 
> for windows or:
> 
> ./Hypercube_N=
EAT -I ./data/CheckersExperiment.dat -O CheckersOutputPopulation.xml -R 100=
0
> 
> for unix/mac
> 
> Jason G.
> 
> 
> --- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "dim=
itar.nedev" <nedev.dimitar@> wrote:
> >
> > Hi all,
> > 
> > After successf=
ully compiling HyperNEAT 2.6 I'm now trying to run a few experiments and as=
 far as I understand I need a configuration file in order to do it.
> > 
> =
> Can anyone please help me with the right command line parameters (I'm una=
ble to compile the GUI) and provide me with a configuration file (or give m=
e some explanation how to make one myself).
> > 
> > I'd be very interested=
 to get the configuration for some of the experiments described in the alre=
ady published papers, so that I can use those results as baseline for compa=
rison my own experiments on my machine.
> > 
> > Cheers,
> > Dimitar
> >
>
=
